page.title: 01THE CITY OF HULL
page.content: Hull is the largest city in the county of Humberside with a population of 269,100. As an important commercial, educational and industrial centre though it serves about 850,000 people. This linking of the region was completed with the opening of the Humber Bridge by Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth ll in 1981. The official title of the city is Kingston-upon-Hull, given to it by Edward l in 1299. This is the first note of the city being used as a port as Edward used it to provision his troops during wartime. From then on the port and the city prospered mainly due to trade from the Baltic and Europe. However the main thing Hull is known for is fish and this is an industry, sadly, much in decline in the 1980's.
